caption: This photograph features a close-up view of a person's right hand and arm. The hand is covered in a dark, mud-like substance up to just above the wrist. The individual is wearing a red long-sleeve shirt and a silver-toned wristwatch with a metallic bracelet. The background consists of a blurry landscape that appears to be an outdoor area with primarily dark, muddy, and watery terrain, indicating the person might be engaged in an activity like mud exploration or a similar outdoor venture. The focus of the image is on the dirty hand, capturing a moment of tactile interaction with the natural environment.
title: In october, 1972, a pipeline of the Texas-New Mexico pipeline company burst, releasing an estimated 285,000 gallons of crude oil into the San Juan river.  Beside the company, five government agencies were involved in the clean-up.  Here, an epa official takes a sample of oil-drenched mud from the clean-up site, a log boom in Monument Valley, Utah
